description: The RVPC, a fully open source hardware and software retro-style computer project built around the CH32V003 microcontroller, now supports a BASIC interpreter. This update further expands the capabilities of the €1 RISC-V-based system, which already features VGA output and PS/2 keyboard input, despite its extremely limited resources. Originally conceived as a DIY challenge, the RVPC […]
title: RVPC Adds BASIC Interpreter to €1 Open Source RISC-V Computer

description: M5Stack is preparing to launch the Tab5, a 5-inch smart touch terminal powered by the ESP32-P4 RISC-V processor, in early May. Designed as a compact and integrated platform for interactive applications, the device combines a multi-touch display, flexible I/O options, and wireless connectivity within a modular form factor. The Tab5 features a 5-inch IPS display […]
title: Upcoming Tab5 Terminal Features 5” Display and RISC-V ESP32-P4 for Edge Applications
